result.execSummary:
The defendant Harley Dean Stands was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant may not consume or possession any alcohol.

The defendant may not enter any taverns/bars.
The defendant must undergo anger management and or psychological counseling and follow thru with all recommendations.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
All othe conditions the same as count 2.
Concurrent with: Count 2

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Harley Dean Stands

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: granted - no Amended JOC prepared - copy faxed to DOC

Called at 2:46 PM. Also called 14CF109, 14CM154. Harley Stands appears in person and with counsel Jeff Joy. State appears by Jodie Bednar-Clemens. State - 14CM154 - amend #1 to county ordinance of DC with motor vehicle - $500 fine plus costs; #2 - plead NC as alleged - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with fine of $300 plus costs, #3 - dismiss, #4 - dismiss; #5 - plead as alleged - $500 fine plus costs; 14CF91 - amend #1 to county ordinance of DC with motor vehicle - $1000 fine plus costs; #2 - amend to obstructing an officer contrary to 946.41 - reads new penalties - $100 fine plus costs; 14CF109 - plead to count #1 as alleged - fine of $100 plus cost, amend #2 - misd BJ contrary to 946.49(1)(a) - reads new penalties - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with fine of $100 plus costs; #3 - plead as alleged - withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year - fine of $100 plus costs; conditions of probation on all cases is: AODA and follow thru, anger managmeent and/or psychological counseling and follow thru, no consumption or possessioin of alcohol, employment/school, 14CM154 - 100 hours of community service; 14CF109 - same conditions of probation except an additional 50 hours of community service; 14CF91 - no probation is requested. Joy and Stands agree. Court - 14CM154 - amends count #1 to county ordinance of DC with motor vehicle, pleads NC, finds G, fine of $500 plus costs totalling $834.50 - take bond posted - remainder due ?, dismiss #3 and #4, pleads NC to count #2 and #5 as alleged; 14CF109 - pleads NC to count #1 as alleged, amends #2 to misd BJ contrary to 946.49(1)(a) - pleads NC to #2 as amended, pleads NC to #3 as alleged; 14CF91 - amend #1 to county ordinance of DC with motor vehicloe, pleads NC, finds G, fine of $1000 plus costs, #2 - amend to obstructing an officer contrary to 946.41 - pleads NC to amended count #2. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Joy makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Strands withhold comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 14CM154 - count #2 - withhold sentence and plcae on probation for 2 years with conditons of: AODA and follow thru, anger management and or psychological counseling and follow thru, $300 fine plus costs - paid thru probation, 100 hours of community service, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars, maintain/obtain full time employment/school with verbage, #5 - $500 fine plus costs,, 14CF109 - #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 yars, same conditions plus additional 50 hours of communtiy service and $100 fine plus costs, #3 - probation for 1 year, fine of $100 plus costs with same conditons except no additional CS, 14CF91 - #2 - fine of $100 plus costs - take bonds posted on all fines, remainder due on all fines within 6 months/CO, right to appeal, adjourned. (pay ordinance violations first)

Called at 9:51 AM. Also called 14CM154 and 14CF109. Harley Stands appears in person and with counsel Jeff Joy. State appears by Charles Simono. State - believes both PH's are being waived. Joy and Stands agree, provides court with waiver of PH form. Court goes thru form, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial on both matters. State files Information that mirrors complaints. Joy has Informations, waives reading of them, will proceed to ARGN on both matters, pleads NG to all counts on both cases. Court continues bond on all cases, accepts NG pleas on both cases, set all matters for FPT on 12/3/14 at 1:15 PM.
Final pre-trial on December 3, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
and certificate of appearance - Deputy CM

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: No consumption of alcohol and no driving without a valid driver's license.
Preliminary hearing on September 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Called at 9:42 AM. Also called 14CF91 and 14CM154. Harley Stands appears in person and in custody with counsel Jeff Joy. State appears by Charles Simono. Joy has complaints in all matters and has discussed them with his client. 14CM154 - waives reading of it and pleads NG to all counts and continues bond and set for STC on 9/22/14 at 8:30 AM. 14CF91 - has complaint, waives reading, waives time limits for PH and sets for PH on 9/22/14 at 8:30 AM, bond is continued. 14CF109 - has complaint, waives reading of it and wants to be heard on bond, set for PH on 9/22/14 at 8:30 AM and will waive time limits for PH. Joy - bond - asks for reduction in bond for stated reasons, $1000.00 cash. State - bond - no objections. Court modifies bond to $1000.00 cash with no consumption of alcohol and no driving without a valid driver's license.
Initial appearance on September 3, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Called at 10:23 AM. Also called 14CM154. Harley Stands appears in via video from FOSO and without counsel. State appears by Charles Simono. Court reviews files. Stands informs court that he does not have counsel yet. Stands informs Court that he is under a new bond of $2500.00 cash - asking for reduction in bond on the new matter. Court makes comments in regards to not having an attorney today. Jeff Joy now steps in on the case - informs Court that he has talked to the defendant previously just to let the court know that the defendant is trying to find an attorney. Stands states that he can afford to hire his own attorney. Court will allow one more adjournment to find an attorney but gives warning and ramifications of appearing again without an attorney. Court continues bond on both of these matters and sets both for AIA on 9/10/14 at 9:45 AM, verifies mailing address of 3091 Sand Lake Road, Crandon, WI. Court will address bond on new case when counsel is hired.
No consumption of alcohol. No driving without valid driver's license.
